comments.body: Since the arguments comes from an arbitrary web query, shouldn't there be some sort of argument sanitization?

It is kind of arguments forwarding to C++ method.
In principle - yes, one have to check for eventual quotes here, otherwise string may be inorrectly handled.

But this PR fixes other problem, I can create another PR for fixing quotes.
In principal, I plan to add special tests (to rottest) to check many of such special cases in THttpServer
